docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 9. -- The Assembly's commission on League of Nations reform today decided to establish a commission of twenty-eight members to study "the application of the principles of the covenant and problems connected therewith."
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 9. -- The Assembly's commission on League of Nations reform today decided to establish a commission of twenty-eight members to study "the application of the principles of the covenant and problems connected therewith."
docs.abstract: Assembly com calls for abolition of quotas and exch controls; provides for work on problem

headline.main: LEAGUE TO NAME 28 TO STUDY REFORMS; Committee to Report With Specific Proposals for Revising Covenant. NON-MEMBERS ARE BARRED Soviet and France Block Move to Seek Views of Nations Not Associated With Geneva.

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREITWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges exhibited a greater degree of stability last week, a sequel to the official devaluation in certain of the European currencies which had been overhanging the market for the last month. The business involved was done along more...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges exhibited a greater degree of stability last week, a sequel to the official devaluation in certain of the European currencies which had been overhanging the market for the last month. The business involved was done along more orderly lines, representing as it did the legitimate requirements of commercial interests with virtually little or no evidence of the speculative activity of previous weeks.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED OCT. 10, 1936
BUENOS AIRES CELEBRATES; Argentine Capital Marks 400th Anniversary of its Founding.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14. -- Thirty foreign countries bought fewer American products in August than in July, although at $178,314,000 the value of the month's foreign shipments represented an increase of more than $6,000,000 over those of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14. -- Thirty foreign countries bought fewer American products in August than in July, although at $178,314,000 the value of the month's foreign shipments represented an increase of more than $6,000,000 over those of the corresponding month last year, according to detailed figures made public today by the Department of Commerce.
docs.abstract: Roper denies Dept of Commerce delays or suppresses figures for pol purposes

headline.main: FOREIGN TRADE UP FROM AUGUST, 1935; But 30 Countries Purchased Less Here in That Month Than They Did in July. DELAY IN REPORT DENIED Roper, Replying to Charges of Politics, Says His Staff Worked Overtime.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 18. -- Argentina has begun diplomatic conversations designed to organize the Latin American republics for a united attempt to save the lives of hundreds of Spaniards who have sought refuge in South American States'...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 18. -- Argentina has begun diplomatic conversations designed to organize the Latin American republics for a united attempt to save the lives of hundreds of Spaniards who have sought refuge in South American States' embassies and legations in Madrid.
docs.abstract: Argentina begins diplomatic negotiations for united attempt by Latin Amer repubs to obtain recognition by Madrid of principal of diplomatic asylum for Spaniards who have taken refuge in South Amer embassies and legations in capital; Madrid govt charges abuse of Montevideo treaty, in that Fascist sympathizers are being harbored

headline.main: ARGENTINA URGES PRESSURE ON SPAIN; 14 Latin-American Envoys Study Buenos Aires Plan to Rescue Rebel Refugees.
